mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Dictyonellidae likely possess basic mechanoreception capabilities to sense water currents and physical contact. This is inferred from the general sensory capabilities of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and potential threats in the water. This is a fundamental aspect of their filter-feeding lifestyle.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Dictyonellidae is currently unknown.
